jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

B7D790E97863488798C1FB9D68921D1C.description:
World: Explain how the environment affected
economic and social developments in a
specific civilization (e.g., Greeks and
the Aegean Sea, Middle East and oil).

CE77884C77B441E1AAAEBC00C70EAA77.description:
United States: Explain how the environment affected
economic and social developments of
people in a specific region (e.g.,
Jamestown, “Wild West,” natural
disasters).

F013E10097DC4AC9A4292BB34B7DCB58.description:
Tell how, as stewards of God’s
creation, they can make environmental
improvements.

E533D9A9D5F344D6845BB3EC26D50A9A.description:
Explain how the environment,
economy, and society can be affected
by the dependence of a region on a
single crop or mode of production.

40B30AEF0C814337A7D53A392FCB7487.description:
Explain how the environment affected
economic and social developments of a
specific cultural group after 1500.

04F203F4248B4A2CAFD4739199E83E5F.description:
Describe the development of
transportation and communication
networks.

F71256E36BB24C0886FBCD221B302700.description:
Identify watershed events in the
environmental history.

DA7BEB5FE5224B9A88D1825EF70A3E4A.description:
Identify the major periods in
environmental history.

979D9FC2C10C4B96A6AC57ED8CCFDFFE.description:
Understand Illinois, United States, and world environmental history (United States). Understand how Church belief regarding creation and God’s providence shape history of United States and the world. Demonstrate a general understanding of the “story” of humanity from creation to present through a Catholic concept of the world and man.
CSGS1
Relate how history begins and ends in God and how history has a religious dimension. CSIS1
Evaluate how societies have been used to provide a sense of coherence and meaning to human life, shaping and forming human culture and
events. CSIS9 (7&8)

F307F34EC0524A64960D0661FCC23293.description:
World: Explain the significance of changes in
the role of men, women, and children
from one period to subsequent periods
in world social history.

053972B4BB73463791C0CF8C16E09D60.description:
United States: Analyze the significance of cultural and
religious diversity in the social history
of the United States.

A415CF302223459FADC45069D0020861.description:
United States: Explain how various interest groups
bring about change (e.g., workers,
business persons, politicians).

B72CD0C9EB9B44D89D530D1138A65A78.description:
Compare/contrast the institution of
slavery in different societies past and
present.

C8B8CD4EC00F48298B6B53EB9093D759.description:
Describe the significance of social
factors such as status, role, customs,
traditions, norms, and values during a
turning point in social history.

3B94F5F7DA9A45AA9B976711AD787E93.description:
Identify the main periods in social
history.

87466B9186E944DE90D790E19C842A4F.description:
Understand Illinois, United States, and world social history (United States/World). Understand social history of Church, Illinois, United States, and world. Demonstrate an understanding about great figures of history by examining their lives for examples of virtue. CSGS2
Value the significance and impact of the Catholic Church throughout history. CSDS5
Examine how one’s own life and life-choices creates a personal history with eternal consequences. CSIS3 (7& 8)
Analyze how God has revealed Himself throughout time and history, in the things we know best and can easily verify. CSIS4 (7&8)
Demonstrate how historical events and patterns of change help us predict and plan for future events CSIS12 (7&8)
Discuss thoughts and deeds of great men and women of the past. CSIS15 (7 & 8)

68654152ACCC4166947B777143CFE667.description:
World: Compare/contrast the economic
systems and institutions of an
agricultural and an industrial society.

C3A17AD0A3A848D290CFE7B63AF51BA9.description:
United States : Describe how changes in economic
activity during an earlier period
influenced subsequent historical events
(e.g., increase in the labor supply and
unionization depression and the New
Deal).

A6DCE8404A734FADBC1C8E2A9F2D1C9F.description:
Evaluate the impact of the economic
aspects of the voyage of Columbus on
the social, political, and environmental
conditions.

2C0036F1C8004122866C5486EC2E92A6.description:
Relate how religion affected economics
during a major period in history.

E69E0A7F8BBF4EBE9204B14F4F62F499.description:
Identify major periods in economic
history.

154D03B6D92F4365AF35B970C14B1267.description:
Understand the development of economic systems (United States/World). Understand how moral or religious thought contributed to the development of economic systems. Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7
Discuss how history can assist man in the acquisition of values and virtues. CSIS12

DA782500DB134DA78C702002FE3F7A38.description: World: Define the concept of Feudalism.

168EBD26A5644D898CDE472027F1B84E.description:
World: Compare/contrast the development of
the political ideology of significant
individuals from a Western civilization
with that of a non-Western civilization.

BABFDA4ABC71475BAC91D35F71AB4BBE.description:
World: Describe political beliefs of significant
individuals and groups during a turning
point in history.

ECCAA6E0FB15431BABD10422A4890FA7.description:
United States: Research decisions made by the
Supreme Court regarding individual
rights and compare to the beliefs of the
Catholic Church.

6E228EB6951D459889CB2B15FEF9E19F.description:
United States: Describe significant events that fostered
the development of representative
democracy after the adoption of the
United States Constitution (e.g.,
amendments, Supreme Court rulings,
legislation).

8B1876CC067D467592A04DB441812500.description:
United States: Explain the growth of democracy in the
United States as reflected in the
Declaration of Independence and the
Constitution of the United States.

73F1BDA7E24C48A19E04D1CB94F4B898.description:
Compare and contrast the contributions
of individuals or political groups who
had a significant impact on local, U.S.
and/or world history.

4FDCFA3F4A1649E6A6E341898C65E6D7.description:
Compare the growth of government
throughout history.

7ED1ACCB7E8F421E88E8985FE85ABEEE.description:
Understand the development of significant political events (United States/World). Understand the development of significant Church or religious events. Explain the history of the Catholic Church and its impact in human events. CSIS4
Exhibit knowledge of essential dates, persons, places and facts, especially those relevant to the western traditions. CSIS5
Recognize how the central themes within the stories of important Catholic figures and saints repeat over time. CSIS6

7472CC5868534FD2860CC05C2E8FA3DC.description:
Tell how and why a significant
historical event impacts the life and
dignity of people.

BC754B06203D49F39EC62C1EBC46FB3B.description:
Explain how a significant historical
event can have many causes.

CBFF88E3079445CC9D70ED168F0DC1C1.description:
Provide an example of two different
interpretations of a significant event.

7885A5DCDF0A46D689021C1983BEE088.description:
Describe life during a specific period
using multiple tier timelines,
periodization charts, graphs, and charts
with data organized by category.

997B07C3D1064BC086BF5FF79BFE2C08.description:
Organize a series of related historical
events for depiction on a periodization
chart.

9B1B46BC6BD2475DA151530B4B1A63D3.description:
Place events from a chronology on
multiple tier timelines that are
organized according to political,
economic, environmental, and social
history.

DA60D3EC24094293ABA7311D7C5F69D1.description:
Apply the skills of historical analysis and interpretation. Apply the skills of historical analysis and interpretation to religious events, trends and Church individuals and movements. Relate that Jesus, as God incarnate, existed in history just like we do. CSIS2
Describe how reading history is a way we can learn about what God does for humanity. CSIS3
Explore how the moral qualities of the citizenry naturally give rise to the nature of the government and influence societal outcomes and
destinies. CSIS13 (7&8)

0E58ADEF49494A1096143FF73ACEDC81.description: Understand events, trends, individuals and movements shaping the history of Illinois, the United States and other Nations. Understand religious events, trends, individuals and movements shaping the history of the United States, other Nations and the Church.
